extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds (41/50 count) peeled and cooked shrimp

title: Southern-Style Pickled Shrimp
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Southern-Style Pickled Shrimp a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 23g of protein, 20g of fat, and a total of 289 calories. For $2.74 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 6. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. A couple people made this recipe, and 76 would say it hit the spot. If you have salt, capers, cider vinegar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the cider vinegar you could follow this main course with the Vinegar Pie as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 50%. This score is good. Similar recipes include Southern-Style Beet Pickled Deviled Eggs, Southern-Style Shrimp, and New Orleans-Style Barbecue Shrimp from 'Mastering the Art of Southern Cooking.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.
